sub_topic: Probability of a certain medical condition occurring
message_1: What is the probability of a randomly selected person having a rare medical condition, given that the condition occurs in 1 out of every 1000 people?
message_2: The probability of a randomly selected person having a rare medical condition that occurs in 1 out of every 1000 people is 1/1000 or 0.001. This means there is a 0.1% chance that a randomly selected person has the rare medical condition.
